newsitem.title: USA: CAI Wireless Systems named in lawsuit.
newsitem.headline: CAI Wireless Systems named in lawsuit.

text.p: CAI Wireless Systems Inc was named in a class action shareholder lawsuit filed on behalf of purchasers of the company's common shares between May 23, 1996 and October 29, 1996, the plaintiff's law firm said.
Representatives from CAI Wireless were not immediately available for comment.

The lawsuit alleges that the company's officers, directors and controlling shareholders publicly promoted their wireless cable television systems, but failed to disclose technical and regulatory problems associated with selling the products successfully, the law firm said.
The law firm, Milberg Weiss Bershad Hynes & Lerach LLP, said that misleading statements have artificially inflated the company's stock price.
